CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 12,13 The highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of this so - called donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units , respectively , thus the band gap can be well tuned by the choice of D and A.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Donor |
| Acceptor |
| D-A type copolymers |

In this paragraph, the following entities are referred to as "Material Names":

* Donor
* Acceptor
* D-A type copolymers

These entities are mentioned in the context of the paragraph's discussion on the localization of the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) in D-A type copolymers, and how the band gap can be tuned by choosing the appropriate donor and acceptor units.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Donor |
| Acceptor |

These are the only entities in the paragraph that can be considered "Material Names", as they refer to specific components of the D-A type copolymers being discussed.
